Vulnerability.Title: kabi-yum-plugins bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
An updated kabi-yum-plugins package that fixes one bug is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The kabi-yum-plugins package contains a yum plug-in that can be used in order to enforce that only those third-party kernel module packages meeting Red Hat kernel Application Binary Interface (ABI) requirements are installed. The plug-in requires that those drivers be packaged in accordance with Red Hat Driver Update Program guidelines.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, the default configuration file provided for the Linux kernel Application Binary Interface (ABI) yum plug-in (kabi-yum-plugins) did not match the kabi white-list file location as provided by the kernel-abi-whitelists package. This led to non-fatal error messages being returned by yum when installing third-party kernel modules. With this update, the config file location has been changed to match the whitelist location, and installing third-party kernel modules now works seamlessly. (BZ#1112731)
Users of kabi-yum-plugins are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
